SCABBARD AND BLADE MILITARY SOCIETY ADMITS
NEW MEMBERS
Society Will Occupy Boxes at Dramatic Club Performance. Dinner Held at Hopkins Club

TOLEDO TO HOLD COURSE
IN SCOUT WORK
The Sociology Department at
Toledo University sponsors classes
in girls' leadership. There are
now forty-two colleges and universities in the United States that
have adopted the plan. Though no
credit is to be given the course will
extend from March 5 to March 17.
It will consist of ten meetings of
of an hour and a half each, which
will be conducted as far as is possible as a Girl Scout Troop with
special emphasis upon problems of
leadership and troop management
and demonstrations by local Girl
Scout Troops.

Dr. Ralph U. O. Magoffin, associate professor of
Greek and Roman history,
was elected president of St.
John's College at a meeting
of the board of governors of
that institution held early
this week.
Dr. Magoffin, who is a
well-known and popular figure on the Hopkins campus,
succeeds Dr. Thomas Fell,
who retires after 37 years as
president. Dr. Magoffin will
probably assume his duties
at the beginning of the next
collegiate year.

He never yet has called upon a prospect without
a previous appointment. The best life insurance

how they can build up earning power and at the

for the years to come.
Graduation is a vital period in your life and you
are liable to hold to the business you start in. It
would be well before making a definite decision to

Society Will Occupy Boxes at Dramatic Club Performance. Dinner Held at Hopkins Club

TOLEDO TO HOLD COURSE
IN SCOUT WORK
The Sociology Department at
Toledo University sponsors classes
in girls' leadership. There are
now forty-two colleges and universities in the United States that
have adopted the plan. Though no
credit is to be given the course will
extend from March 5 to March 17.
It will consist of ten meetings of
of an hour and a half each, which
will be conducted as far as is possible as a Girl Scout Troop with
special emphasis upon problems of
leadership and troop management
and demonstrations by local Girl
Scout Troops.

Dr. Ralph U. O. Magoffin, associate professor of
Greek and Roman history,
was elected president of St.
John's College at a meeting
of the board of governors of
that institution held early
this week.
Dr. Magoffin, who is a
well-known and popular figure on the Hopkins campus,
succeeds Dr. Thomas Fell,
who retires after 37 years as
president. Dr. Magoffin will
probably assume his duties
at the beginning of the next
collegiate year.
